Please rebase.
done.
Is bash necessary here or is sh sufficent?
Done, I've changed the function declaration to fit the naming requirement of sh.
Suggest quotes as appropriate around individual parameters.
Done.
Fix trailing whitespace please.
Done.

Please format with `prettier` for consistency.

You can find the arguments and default config we use in openbmc-build-scripts repo, scripts/format-code.sh
Done, thanks for the tip.
Prefer we follow up with adding PACKAGECONFIG to the base phosphor-fan recipe rather than keep adding more meson flags.

I think that is better, but I have a concern, the system recovery detection is a subfunction of sensor-monitor, which is not the 5 major applications of phosphor-fan-presence (Control, presence, monitor, etc.). Currently, PACKAGECONFIG in the base recipe maps to each application of phosphor-fan-presence, I'm not sure whether a new item in PACKAGECONFIG would cause confusion?

Keep it this way in this commit.  We can make a new commit to add these as PACKAGECONFIG in phosphor-fan.

Generally you want to refrain from EXTRA_OEMESON calls in any bbappend and instead get the underlying package to have a PACKAGECONFIG.  I'm not understanding the possible confusion.
Sure, I'll add the feature of recovery detection into PACKAGECONFIG to the base recipe after this commit is accepted, thanks for the feedback.

Please avoid tabs.

SRC_URI:append:greatlakes = " \
    file:// ... \
    file:// ... \
    "
Done.
merge conflict marker.
Done.
Do we want to use an append here?  'use-host-power-state' is already enabled by default in meta-facebook.
I used an append on my first try (i.e., EXTRA_OCMESON:greatlakes:append), but it turns out that the statement in meta-facebook was overrode, that is why I re-claim here, is there something I missed?
Go ahead and change the EXTRA_OEMESON in meta-facebook/recipes-phosphor-fans/phosphor-fan_%.bbappend to `+=` or `:append`.
Thanks, I've solved it and delete the 'use-host-power-state' at greatlakes layer.
nit: please indent continuation strings for readability.
Done
I don't see this option in the codebase.
The option has been added in an un-merged feature (https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-fan-presence/+/60340), therefore this commit depends on 60340.
A few nits.  Looks like the dependent commit isn't merge yet.
Yeah, I think that commit (60340) is almost ready to merge under Matt's review, I'll keep tracking it.
please use ${datadir} instead of the hard-coded path.
Done, thanks for the reminder.
please use ${libexec} instead of the hard-coded path.
Done.
